summary_md:
# PTD Today Forward Watchlist (Rest of Year — Headline Signals Last 30 Days)

## 1) Themes to Watch
- Offshore wind project developments and ownership changes amid regulatory challenges (e.g., Orsted’s $5B U.S. offshore wind project halted; Apollo co-owns Hornsea 3)
- Solar market growth and pricing trends in major regions (China wafer price quotes, UK record CfD solar deployment, large-scale projects in India, Bangladesh, Nepal)
- AI technology adoption in energy-related applications (digital twins for floating PV using AI; AI inference economics highlighted)
- Security risks to critical infrastructure (subsea cable cutting incident involving detained Russian crew)
- Semiconductor industry outlook and capacity concerns (Intel’s new Arizona fab under scrutiny)
- Domestic content mandates affecting battery/storage project supply chains (India’s 20% domestic content requirement)

## 2) What to Monitor Next
- **Grid / Renewables**
  - Impact of U.S. regulatory decisions on offshore wind project timelines and financing
  - Expansion of solar capacity via record CfD awards in UK and emerging projects in India, Bangladesh, Nepal
  - Utility policy shifts toward flexible grid connections for community solar and potential effects on grid efficiency
- **Oil & Gas**
  - Not enough information in headlines to gauge short-term signals
- **Data Centers & AI**
  - Influence of AI economics and inference trade on energy consumption and data center demand
  - Integration of AI-enabled digital tools in renewable energy asset management (floating PV)
- **Semiconductors**
  - Intel’s Arizona fab performance and strategic importance amid broader chip industry pressures
  - Pricing trends in China’s wafer and module supply chain for solar manufacturing
- **Critical Minerals**
  - Effects of India’s domestic content mandates in battery storage on mineral sourcing and supply chains
  - Not enough direct info on rare earths or minerals elsewhere

## 3) Regions / Companies Appearing Repeatedly
- China (solar manufacturing, wafer price quotes)
- United States (offshore wind regulatory environment, solar market capacity, Intel fab)
- India (solar manufacturer Waaree Energies, battery storage policy)
- UK (record solar CfD deployment, Hornsea 3 offshore wind - Apollo involvement)
- Bangladesh and Nepal (solar project tenders and monitoring)
- Orsted (offshore wind project dispute in U.S.)
- Apollo (investment in UK offshore wind)

## 4) Constraints / Risks Implied by Headlines
- Regulatory and bureaucratic delays impacting large offshore wind projects in the U.S.
- Supply chain disruption potential from policy mandates on domestic content in battery/storage
- Geopolitical/security risk to subsea cables from reported interference and detentions
- Potential cost pressure from rising Chinese solar wafer/module prices in 2026
- Workforce and skills shortage in engineering may affect renewable and semiconductor project execution (alluded to in FT “blue-collar jobs revival” and engineer shortage coverage)
